title: IFA members occupy Bord Bia office in Dublin
desc: Around 30 members of the IFA are continuing a sit-down protest inside the offices of Bord Bia in Dublin this evening, in an escalation of their protest calling for the removal of the agency's chair, Larry Murrin.

title: ‘Can barely walk’: Ollie Peake’s heroic hundred goes in vain as England end Aussie U19 World Cup defence
desc: ‘Can barely walk’: Rising star’s heroic ton in vain as Aussie U19 title defence ends

title: Son of Norway's crown princess denies rape charges
desc: The son of Norway's crown princess has pleaded not guilty to rape and domestic violence, but admitted to lesser charges on the first day of his trial.

title: Lord of the Dance show at 3Arena to go ahead despite earlier cancellation
desc: Michael Flatley granted injunction by High Court in Belfast to allow 30th anniversary show to be staged in Dublin

title: U.S. ski star Lindsey Vonn vows to race at Milano-Cortina Olympics despite 'ruptured' ACL
desc: Lindsey Vonn is "confident" she can compete at the Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics beginning this week despite the left knee injury she sustained in a crash four days ago.

title: Irish man in court after fatal stabbing of another Irishman in Bucharest - local reports
desc: The Department of Foreign Affairs is aware of the case and is providing consular assistance.

title: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee to appear in Supreme Court tomorrow to argue SIR case
desc: Bar and Bench has seen the Supreme Court gate pass issued to West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee for February 4, 2026

title: Lack of pediatric data restricts use of life-saving antibiotics
desc: Life-saving antibiotics that could treat severe infections in babies and children aren't accessible due to a lack of data around safety and dosage, new research shows.

title: Man pleads guilty to sexual assault of girl on flight
desc: A man has pleaded guilty to the sexual assault of a then 16-year-old girl on board an Aer Lingus flight bound for Boston.

title: Butcher ‘killed her girlfriend with horse figurine, then cut her in two’
desc: Anna Podedworna says it was ‘the only way’ to hide Izabela Zablocka’s body
